required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Intensity Matters: Therapist-dependent Dose of Spinal Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation

collaborator.agency: Hospital Nacional de Parapléjicos de Toledo

brief_summary.textblock: The intensity used during transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation (TENS) in both, clinical practice and research studies, is often based on subjective commands such as "strong but comfortable sensation". There is not consensus regarding the effectiveness dose of TENS

detailed_description.textblock: Twenty healthy volunteers will divide into two groups: Therapist 1 and Therapist 2. Both therapist will apply spinal TENS and sham stimulation for 40min in random order to each subject, at an intensity to produce a "strong but comfortable sensation".

primary_outcome.time_frame: At the onset (0min) of the Spinal TENS session
primary_outcome.description: Current density (mA/cm2) is obtained by a mathematical operation which reflects the applied current intensity divided by the electrode area (45cm2)

primary_outcome.time_frame: At the end (40min) of the Spinal TENS session
primary_outcome.description: Current density (mA/cm2) is obtained by a mathematical operation which reflects the applied current intensity divided by the electrode area (45cm2)

secondary_outcome.description: H-reflex data are obtained by electromyography activity (EMG). The EMG electrode is fixed on triceps surae. The stimulator electrode is fixed on the peroneus nerve, in the popliteal fossa.

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline Maximal peak-to-peak soleus M wave
secondary_outcome.description: M wave ddata are obtained by electromyography activity (EMG). The EMG electrode is fixed on triceps surae. The stimulator electrode is fixed on the peroneus nerve, in the popliteal fossa.

Normalized H-reflex response data are obtained by electromyography activity (EMG). The EMG electrode is fixed on triceps surae. The stimulator electrode is fixed on the peroneus nerve, in the popliteal fossa.
H-reflex data are obtained by electromyography activity (EMG). The EMG electrode is fixed on triceps surae. The stimulator electrode is fixed on the peroneus nerve, in the popliteal fossa.

secondary_outcome.measure: During Maximal peak-to-peak soleus M wave
secondary_outcome.description: M wave data are obtained by electromyography activity (EMG). The EMG electrode is fixed on triceps surae. The stimulator electrode is fixed on the peroneus nerve, in the popliteal fossa.

Normalized H-reflex response data are obtained by electromyography activity (EMG). The EMG electrode is fixed on triceps surae. The stimulator electrode is fixed on the peroneus nerve, in the popliteal fossa.
H-reflex data are obtained by electromyography activity (EMG). The EMG electrode is fixed on triceps surae. The stimulator electrode is fixed on the peroneus nerve, in the popliteal fossa.

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-treatment Maximal peak-to-peak soleus M wave
secondary_outcome.description: M wave data are obtained by electromyography activity (EMG). The EMG electrode is fixed on triceps surae. The stimulator electrode is fixed on the peroneus nerve, in the popliteal fossa.

secondary_outcome.measure: Post-treatment Normalized H-reflex responseMaximal peak-to-peak soleus H-reflex
secondary_outcome.description: Normalized H-reflex response data are obtained by electromyography activity (EMG). The EMG electrode is fixed on triceps surae. The stimulator electrode is fixed on the peroneus nerve, in the popliteal fossa.

arm_group.description: Spinal TENS stimulation: A constant voltage and a symmetric biphasic current of 200 microseg pulse-width at a frequency of 100Hz. The intensity will increase until participants report a "strong but comfortable" sensation, just below motor threshold.

The same procedures as experimental group, but but will be applied a sham electrical stimulation increasing the current intensity until sensory perception of the stimulus, and then decreased to zero where it will fix until the end of the stimulation.

intervention.description: Spinal TENS stimulation over back through the electrotherapy device Myomed 932. (Enraf-Nonius, Delft, Netherlands)
Sham stimulation over back through the electrotherapy device Myomed 932. (Enraf-Nonius, Delft, Netherlands)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy volunteers between 18 and 60 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- Musculoskeletal pathology of the lower limbs
- History of neuromuscular disease
- Unable to tolerate electrical current
- Allergy to the electrode material
- Pacemaker or any implanted device
- Epilepsy
- Neurotrauma
- Recent surgical procedures
- Pain affecting the lower limbs or lower back
- Diabetes
- Pregnancy
- Cancer

overall_official.affiliation: Hospital Nacional de Parapléjicos de Toledo
